data.name: Parco dei Principi Grand Hotel & SPA
data.hotelDescription:
Luxurious Accommodations and Stunning Views

Experience unparalleled luxury at the Parco dei Principi Grand Hotel & SPA, where each room offers breathtaking views of Rome's iconic landmarks. Relax in style in our spacious rooms equipped with state-of-the-art amenities and enjoy the lush garden vistas from your window.

Gourmet Dining and Relaxation

Treat your taste buds at the Pauline Borghese gourmet restaurant, offering a delightful culinary experience overlooking the summer pool. Unwind at the Prince Spa with a range of wellness facilities including indoor pool, sauna, and Turkish bath. Indulge in beauty treatments and savor herbal teas in the serene relaxation area.

Convenience and Accessibility

Conveniently located next to Villa Borghese park, our hotel is a short walk from the renowned Galleria Borghese museum and easily accessible from Roma Termini Train Station. Book now for an unforgettable stay at Parco dei Principi Grand Hotel & SPA.
data.hotelImportantInformation:
Swimming pool Outdoor is closed from Tue 01 Oct 2024 until Wed 30 Apr 2025
Please note that spa access is only permitted to children over 4 years of age, who must be accompanied by an adult. Use of the spa may come at an extra cost.

Please note the extra bed for a child is free only when booking a rate for 2 adults.

Please note that the pool is open from 09:00 until 19:00 and comes at an extra cost.

Massages are at extra cost.
hotelFacilities: Staff adhere to local safety protocols
Cleaning standards that are effective against Coronavirus
Hand sanitizer in guest room and key areas
Guests can opt-out any cleaning services during stay
Shared stationery like menus, pens are removed
Property cleaned by professional cleaning companies
Process in place to check health of guests

rooms.roomName: Deluxe Double Or Twin Room With Balcony
rooms.description:
Offering free WiFi, this larger air-conditioned room features antique furnishings and a balcony with views of Villa Borghese. It includes satellite LCD TV, a minibar and a private bathroom with hairdryer.

Please specify bed preference when booking.

rooms.roomName: Junior Suite Villa Borghese Park View
rooms.description:
Offers antique furniture, fine fabrics, wood panelling and views of Villa Borghese and St. Peter's Basilica. It includes a seating area, satellite LCD TV, a minibar and a private bathroom with hairdryer.

Please specify bed preference when booking.

policies.name: Groups
policies.description: When booking more than 4 rooms, different policies and additional supplements may apply.

policies.name: Pets
policies.description: Pets are allowed on request. Charges may be applicable.

policies.name: Internet
policies.description: WiFi is available in all areas and is free of charge.

policies.name: Parking
policies.description: Private parking is possible on site (reservation is not needed) and costs  EUR 35 per  day.

policies.name: Children and extra bed policy
policies.description:
Children of any age are allowed.
Children up to and including 3 years old stay for free when using an available cot.
Children up to and including 3 years old stay for free when using an existing bed.
Children from 4 years old to 17 years old stay for € 120 per person per night when using an existing bed.
You haven't added any extra beds.
Any type of extra bed or child's cot/crib is upon request and needs to be confirmed by management.
Supplements are not calculated automatically in the total costs and will have to be paid for separately during your stay.

cons: Expensive spa rules and noise disturbances

categories.name: Cleanliness
categories.description: Guests consistently mentioned cleanliness as a positive aspect.

categories.name: Service
categories.description: Service was generally appreciated, with helpful staff being a common positive highlight.

categories.name: Location
categories.description: The hotel is located in an excellent area, providing a relaxing and tranquil environment for guests.

categories.name: Room Quality
categories.description: Rooms were spacious, comfortable, and elegantly designed, with comfortable beds being a standout feature.

categories.name: Amenities
categories.description: The amenities provided were satisfactory, with the spa and swimming pool receiving positive mentions.

categories.name: Value for Money
categories.description: Opinions on value for money varied, with some guests feeling the price was high for the services offered.

categories.name: Food and Beverage
categories.description: Breakfast and restaurant services were generally well-received, though some guests desired more variety.

categories.name: Overall Experience
categories.description: Most guests had a positive overall experience and would recommend the hotel to others.

data.name: Kimberley
data.headline: Great hotel with fantastic pool.
data.pros: This hotel is incredible for those who want facilities like a large pool, gymnasium and garden.  There was a heat wave in Rome when my family visited at the end of June and the pool was invaluable.  It provided a haven away from the hustle, bustle and heat of the city and was a lovely way to spend the afternoon after morning tours with the family.  The breakfast was also superb and it was lovely sitting on the balcony overlooking the garden of the hotel. The beds were also great.
data.cons: It is a short taxi ride from the centre of the old town but we had no rouble getting taxis even though this was peak season.

data.name: Perry
data.headline: Overall excellent. Would return without hesitation
data.pros: The location is fantastic - an oasis of calm in a hectic and overcrowded city. The hotel rooms are very comfortable and truly 5 star. Breakfast also excellent.
data.cons: The situation at the pool seems unusual to me. The pool loungers nearest the swimming pool were all reserved for people who were not guests at the hotel. They evidently pay a day rate to use the pool facilities but this leads to an overcrowded pool area with insufficient facilities for the paying guests staying at the hotel. The pool area also closed early on 2 nights because of a private function at the pool bad. In my opinion a true 5 star hotel should prioritize the guest experience rather than capitalising on day visitors and private functions.

data.name: beccablack13
data.headline: Beautiful hotel in Rome
data.pros: Amazing! Luxury grounds and accommodating staff. We were able to walk through the gardens to sightseeing when the weather was nice.

data.name: Sherry
data.headline: This wa among our favorite hotels during a month-long tour of Europe
data.pros:
Fabulous property! Helpful staff; good restaurant recommendations. 
Lovely breakfast. Beautiful swimming pool & park-like grounds were a welcome respite after days of touring Rome w/ temps in the 90s.  Great beds/mattresses - best we’ve encountered in Italy-  and spacious rooms & bathrooms.

data.name: Alexandra
data.headline: A perfect hotel in every way - absolute treasure of a place
data.pros: Beautiful inside and so relaxing and sophisticated

data.name: Lee
data.headline: Parco dei Principe spa hotel
data.pros: Loved the beautiful decor and 16th/17th century original oil paintings.
data.cons:
The included Spa wanted to make us wear swimming caps even though we were not even going to dip our heads. Unsurprisingly, nobody was using said spa!!
It was disappointing as it looked ok, ive used much better spas and not been made to wear a cap or been subject to overly strict rules.
